alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:12PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Goshen and southeastern Platte Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Guernsey Campground to near Fort Laramie National Historic Site to Grayrocks Reservoir to Chugcreek. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Highway weather stations reported wind gusts over 50 mph along I-25. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wheatland, Guernsey, Lingle, Fort Laramie, Chugcreek, Lakeview North, Bordeaux, Westview Circle, Y-O Ranch, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Slater, Grayrocks Reservoir, Guernsey Campground, Hartville and Hwy 85 At Dry Rawhide Creek. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 68 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County
